column3: Religion Héroique dans sa terre d'origine

column2: The Druid's knowledge of the ancient songs and of sacred traditions is great and their power among believers is without equal. They are responsible for organising worship and sacrifices, divination, and judicial procedure in Druidic society. In exchange for this knowledge and power, they give up all rights to inherit feudal lands.
This Druid has decided to use the ancient secrets of the Druid for their own personal gain, such sacrilegious behavior is unfitting of a Druid.
A Druid has just arrived in this lord's court.
Responsible for organising worship and sacrifices, divination, and judicial procedure in Druidic society, they are as essential to a ruler as his sword.

Bards were those who sang the songs recalling the Druidic lore of old as well as the ancient folk tales native to this land. The people of the north maintain an intricate oral history committed to memory and transmitted by bards. Bards facilitated the memorization of such materials by the use of metre, rhyme and other formulaic poetic devices.
An unwashed, mysterious wizard from the countryside, his powers are unclear, but they serve to appease the more occult worries of a ruler.
column3: Un païen, mystérieux et sale, venu de la campagne, ses pouvoir ne sont pas clair, mais servent à résoudre les problèmes les plus... ésotériques d'un souverain

column2: The best warrior of the land, the title of champion is a great honor among Druidics, their task is to protect their king.
column3: Le meilleur guerrier du pays, le titre de champion est un grand honneur parmis le peuple Celte.

column2: The wingers descend from a class of legendary ancient warriors who once roamed throughout the frozen north. These upper class warriors favour red tunics, and are masters of navigating frozen and rough terrain. The wingers are typically armed with lances or polearms.

The Puowinu'g are one of three classes of Druidic priesthood, the other two being the druids and the bards. The Puowinu'g have the role of seers and healers, and assist druids with their expertise in certain types of ancient knowledge that Druids are often unfamiliar with.
The Chariot Master is charged with maintaining the lord's chariots and horses. A position of trust, the honor is only bestowed on warriors, who understand the needs of a charioteer.
column3: Le Maître du Char est chargé de maintenir les chars et les chevaux du Seigneur. Une position de confiance, l'honneur est seulement accordé aux guerriers, qui comprennent les besoins d'un conducteur de voiture.

column2: The Headsman is charged with the care of the royal family's collection of preserved heads. While the actual labor of refilling the jars with juniper oil and replacing damaged vessels is left to servants, they are directed by the Headsman.
column3: Le bourreau est chargé des soins de la collection de têtes conservées de la famille royale. Le travail réel de remplissage des pots à l'huile de genièvre et le remplacement des vaisseaux endommagés est laissé aux serviteurs, ils sont dirigés par le bourreau.

column2: The Wardens are responsible for the royal hunting grounds and generally preserving and protecting the wild places from people, and the people from the wild places. The duties of this office are divided into Wards: North, South, East, and West.
column3: Les Gardiens sont responsables des terrains de chasse royaux et en général la préservation et la protection des lieux sauvages de personnes, et les gens des lieux sauvages. Les fonctions de ce bureau sont divisées en quartiers: Nord, Sud, Est et Ouest.

column2: Your injuries are a sign of weakness. It would be wise to abdicate your throne for the safety of your people.
column3: Vos blessures sont un signe de faiblesse, suivez donc l'exemple du grand Nuada, Il serait plus sage d'abdiquer pour le bien de votre peuple.

column2: For the glory of Talamh an Éisc!
A serious injury to this ruler's body has made his rule illegitimate in the eyes of his people
column3: Une blessure grave a rendu le règne de ce souverain illégitime aux yeux de son peuple.

column2: This character is a veteran of the Red Dragon Knights.
column3: Ce caractère est un vétéran des Chevaliers Dragons Rouges

column2: This character is a veteran of the knightly warbands.
column3: Cette personne est un vétéran de la compagnie de chevaliers.

column2: This character is a veteran of the Sons of Glooscap.
column3: Ce caractère est un vétéran des fils de Glooscap

column2: This character is a veteran of a Druidic Great Holy War.
column3: Ce personnage est un vétéran d'une grande guerre sainte Druidique.

column2: Shrines are built in honor of the gods\n
Ancient meeting place of the giant Fomorians, this place has kept a great importance for the sons of Mil.
Sacred stone of Kings sitting on top of the hill of Tara, at the touch of the rightful king of New England, it screams his name three times.
Whether the remnants of a Sasanach army turned to stone by Merlin or ancient temple grounds of their primeval ancestors, the stones of Carnac are considered a sacred destination by many Druidics.
An important pilgrimage site, this stone circle, standing from times immemorial, is often used by the Druids for their sacred ceremonies.
Known as the sacred centre of Ceanada, this hill is also the chosen site for the annual celebration of Beltaine.
Most important stone circle in Ceap Breatainn, the Druids have made this a sacred temple to the Gods
The Bear is highly sacred in this region, thought to be the earthly avatar of many powerful gods and goddesses.
Protected by Macha, the white horses are a sign of the favour she has for this region.
A symbol of immortality, the mighty yew trees that grow in the sacred groves are a gift from the Gods.
Companion to the Gods and the many spirits of the land, the stags and deer of this area are particularly healthy.
Dogs were seen to be keen-scented, good at hunting, guarding and healing themselves, their abundance in this region is clearly a gift.
The great Oaks and the sacred mistletoe that they bear are of utmost importance to the Druidics.
Often the site of pilgrimages, standing stones are a boon for any lord, their presence lending prestige and protection.
This mysterious lake is often the recipient of gifts to the Gods, for its waters are considered a pathway to the Otherworld.
The waters flowing from this source are thought to hold healing powers and are thus sacred.
A goddess is believed to reside in the waters of this river, blessing all peoples living near it.
Of all the Druids in my realm, this one is the likeliest to enter the Circle of Druids
column3: De tout les Druides de mon royaume, c'est celui qui a le plus de chance d'entrer dans le Cercle des Druides

column2: This druid is probably the next member of the Circle, once a position becomes available
column3: Ce druide est probablement le prochain membre du Cercle, dés qu'un siège sera vacant.

column2: The followers of the Druidic faith have long known persecution, especially from Christian hands. As always, they persevere, even if they must use deception. Though they utter empty prayers to foreign gods, they secretly meet in private chambers and secluded groves to offer devotion and sacrifice to Danu, the Mother and source of life. They keep their faith knowing that some day mighty Taranis the Thunderer will strike down those who have persecuted the faithful.

The new Druidic faith may be young, but it's followers are no less devout than any other. Even when they must publicly profess faith in false gods, the children of Danu plan and prepare for the day when they might worship the gods in the light of day. They know that none can long stand against the might of Lug of the Long Spear, and those that opress them will get what they deserve.
The §YDruidic§! shrine in §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! has drawn my attention of late. It feels ancient, patient, and powerful. It seems to be waiting to reveal it's secrets. I am tempted to listen...
The §YDruidic§! pilgrims that flock to the holy site in §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! impress me with the depth and passion of their faith. I am tempted to convert in secrecy...
column3: Les pèlerins §YDruidique§! qui affluent vers le site saint en §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! m'impressionnent avec la profondeur et la passion de leur foi. Je suis tenté[Root.GetNoneE] de me convertir en secret...
column4: Die §YDruidic§! Pilger in §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! beeindrucken mich durch die Tiefe und die Leidenschaft ihres Glaubens. Ich bin versucht, heimlich zu konvertieren ...
column6: Los peregrinos §YDruidicas§! que acuden en masa al lugar sagrado en §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! me impresionan con la profundidad y la pasión de su fe. Me tienta convertirme en secreto...

column2: In secret, Druidic faithfuls have organized themselves as a community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.
column3: Des fidèles celtique païen ont secrètement formé une communauté dans cette province. Ils y convertissent les autres personnes et protègent les leurs.
column4: In dieser Provinz haben sich Anhänger des keltischen heidnischen Glaubens heimlich zu einer Gemeinde organisiert. Von dort aus bekehrt diese Gemeinde andere, wird immer größer und beschützt ihre Mitglieder.
column6: Los fieles de celtico pagano han creado una comunidad secreta en esta provincia. De este modo convierten a otros, crecen y protegen a los suyos.

column2: In secret, Druidic faithfuls have organized themselves as a community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.
column3: Des fidèles Druidiques ont secrètement formé une communauté dans cette province. Ils y convertissent les autres personnes et protègent les leurs.
column4: In dieser Provinz haben sich Anhänger des druidisch Glaubens heimlich zu einer Gemeinde organisiert. Von dort aus bekehrt diese Gemeinde andere, wird immer größer und beschützt ihre Mitglieder.
column6: Los fieles de Druida han creado una comunidad secreta en esta provincia. De este modo convierten a otros, crecen y protegen a los suyos.

column2: In an effort to convince the court of my commitment to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], I have gone to [Root.GetHouseOfWorship], to make an offering at the altar of the gods. A [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] eyes me warily as I walk up the steps and enter the building. May [Root.GetTrueReligionHighGod] forgive me, but I need to make a good impression here.
column3: Dans un effort visant à convaincre la Cour de mon engagement envers [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], je suis devant l'entrée [Root.GetHouseOfWorshipDuDela] pour laisser une offrande à l'autel des dieux. Un [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] me regarde avec méfiance alors que je gravis les marches et entre dans le bâtiment. Que [Root.GetTrueReligionHighGod] me pardonne, mais je dois faire bonne impression ici.
column4: Um den Hof von meiner Hingabe zu [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] zu überzeugen, bin ich zum/zur [Root.GetHouseOfWorship] gegangen, um am Altar der Götter eine Opfergabe darzubringen. Ein/e [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] schaut mich misstrauisch an, als ich die Stufen hinaufsteige und das Gebäude betrete. Möge [Root.GetTrueReligionHighGod] mir vergeben, aber ich muss hier einen guten Eindruck machen.
column6: En un intento de convencer a la corte de mi compromiso con [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], he ido al templo para hacer una ofrenda en el altar de los dioses. El religioso me observa con recelo mientras subo los peldaños y entro en el edificio. Que [Root.GetTrueReligionHighGod] me perdone, pero debo dar una buena impresión.

column2: As I step up in front of them, my people eye me carefully. They depend on their [Root.GetTitle], and [Root.GetHerHis] connection to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], to guide them. The [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] nods at me, and I stare into the flames of the altar candle lights for a moment. When I finally speak, I imagine that I am praising [Root.GetTrueReligionHighGod]  unsurprising, my words have never seemed more true.
column3: En me levant devant eux, mon peuple me regarde attentivement. Ils comptent sur leur [Root.GetTitle] et sur sa connexion avec [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] pour les guider. Le [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] m'encourage d'un hochement de tête, et je fixe les flammes des bougies de l'autel pendant un moment. Quand je parle enfin, j'imagine que je loue [Root.GetTrueReligionHighGod]  sans surprise, mes paroles n'ont jamais semblé plus vraies.
column4: Als ich zum Altar hochgehe, beobachten mich meine Untertanen aufmerksam. Sie sind von mir als [Root.GetTitle] und meiner Verbindung zu [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] abhängig, damit ich sie richtig führe. Der/die [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] nickt mir zu, und ich starre für eine Weile in die Flammen der Kerzen des Altars. Als ich schließlich zu reden beginne, stelle ich mir vor, [Root.GetTrueReligionHighGod] zu preisen, und es überrascht mich nicht, dass es mir so vorkommt, als hätte ich noch nie wahrere Worte gesprochen.
column6: Cuando me coloco ante los fieles, me miran con atención. Cuentan con su [Root.GetTitle] y con su conexión con [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] para guiarlos. El religioso me mira y asiente, y yo observo las llamas de las velas del altar durante un momento. Al fin empiezo a hablar e imagino que alabo a [Root.GetTrueReligionHighGod] como era de esperar, mis palabras nunca han parecido tan ciertas.

column2: As I step up to the altar, the [Root.Religion.GetGroupName]s eye me warily. They depend upon me, as [Root.GetTitle] and my connection to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], to guide them. The [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] nods solemnly at me. I look up at the ornamental windows of the [Root.GetHouseOfWorship], silently begging [Root.GetTrueReligionHighGod] for some surge of inspiration  it never comes. I run off the stage, leaving rows of people confused.
column3: Alors que je monte vers l'autel, les [Root.Religion.GetGroupName]s m'observent avec méfiance. Ils comptent sur moi, en tant que [Root.GetTitle] et sur ma connexion avec [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] pour les guider. Le [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] me fait un signe solennel. Je regarde les fenêtres ornementales [Root.GetHouseOfWorshipDuDela], en suppliant silencieusement [Root.GetTrueReligionHighGod] pour une certaine poussée d'inspiration  qui ne vient jamais. Je cours hors de la scène, laissant des rangées de gens confus.
column4: Als ich zum Altar hochgehe, beobachten mich die Anhänger der Religion [Root.Religion.GetName] misstrauisch. Sie sind von mir als [Root.GetTitle] und meiner Verbindung zu [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] abhängig, damit ich sie richtig führe. Der/die [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] nickt mir feierlich zu. Ich schaue zu den verzierten Fenstern im/in der [Root.GetHouseOfWorship] hinauf und bitte [Root.GetTrueReligionHighGod] stumm um eine Eingebung, doch diese Eingebung kommt einfach nicht. Ich renne von der Bühne und lasse die Reihen der Anwesenden verwirrt hinter mir zurück.
column6: Cuando subo al altar, los [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] me observan con recelo. Cuentan conmigo como [Root.GetTitle], y con mi conexión con [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] para guiarlos. El religioso me mira y asiente con solemnidad. Alzo la vista hacia las ventanas ornamentales de [Root.GetHouseOfWorship], suplicando en silencio a [Root.GetTrueReligionHighGod] una pizca de inspiración... pero no llega. Bajo corriendo de la tarima, dejando a filas de asistentes confundidos.

column2: I step up to the altar and make a quick decision  as I reach the center of the stage I collapse to the floor. The worshipers gasp as I, their [Root.GetTitle], begin quoting [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName]. I roll my eyes back as I speak, as if confronting the skies themselves. When my last words ring out, everyone seems to be holding their breath. For a moment I worry that my stunt has failed. Then the [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] exclaims "A VISION! My [Root.GetLordLady], let me help you stand!"
column3: Je m'approche de l'autel et je prends une décision rapide  en arrivant au centre de la scène, je m'effondre au sol. Les adorateurs halètent alors que moi, leur [Root.GetTitle], commence à citer [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName]. Je révulse mes yeux et parle, comme si j'étais confronté[Root.GetNoneE] aux cieux eux-mêmes. Quand mes derniers mots retentissent, tout le monde semble retenir son souffle. Pendant un instant, j'ai peur que mon petit tour ait échoué. Puis, le [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] s'écrie : « UNE VISION ! M[Root.GetOnA][Root.GetLordLady], laissez-moi vous aider à vous tenir debout ! »
column4: Ich gehe zum Altar hoch und treffe blitzschnell eine Entscheidung. Als ich die Mitte der Bühne erreiche, breche ich einfach zusammen. Die Gläubigen schnappen nach Luft, als ich, ihr/e [Root.GetTitle], anfange, aus der Schrift [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] zu zitieren. Ich verdrehe meine Augen nach hinten, während ich spreche, als würde ich mich an den Himmel selbst wenden. Als meine letzten Worte verklingen, scheinen alle den Atem anzuhalten. Einen Moment lang mache ich mir Sorgen, dass mein Trick vielleicht misslungen ist. Doch dann ruft der/die [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]: EINE VISION! Mein/e [Root.GetLordLady], lasst mich Euch auf die Füße helfen!"
column6: Me subo al altar y tomo una rápida decisión: cuando alcanzo el centro de la tarima, me desplomo en el suelo. A los adoradores se les corta la respiración cuando yo, su [Root.GetTitle], empiezo a citar las sagradas escrituras. Pongo los ojos en blanco mientras hablo, como si estuviera viendo los cielos mismos. Cuando pronuncio las últimas palabras, todos siguen aguantando el aliento. Por un momento temo que mi ardid haya fracasado. Entonces el religioso exclama: ¡Una visión! Mi [Root.GetLordLady], deja que te ayude a ponerte en pie!"."

column2: I step forwards and make a bold decision  as I reach a group of people I collapse to the floor. The worshipers gasp as I, their [Root.GetTitle], begin quoting fragments of [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName]. I roll my eyes back as I speak, as if confronting the skies themselves. When my last words ring out, they start to whisper. For a moment I am convinced that my stunt has succeeded. Then the [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] prods at me. "Uhm, my [Root.GetLordLady]? Let's get you back onto your feet."
column3: Je fais un pas en avant et prends une décision audacieuse  lorsque j'atteins un groupe de gens, je m'effondre au sol. Les adorateurs halètent alors que moi, leur [Root.GetTitle], commence à citer [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName]. Je révulse mes yeux et parle, comme si j'étais confronté[Root.GetNoneE] aux cieux eux-mêmes. Quand mes derniers mots retentissent, ils commencent à chuchoter. Pendant un instant, je suis convaincu[Root.GetNoneE] que mon petit tour a réussi. Puis le [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] me secoue pour voir si je réagis. « Uhm, M[Root.GetOnA][Root.GetLordLady] ? On va vous aider à vous relever. »
column4: Ich trete nach vorne und treffe eine kühne Entscheidung. Als ich eine Gruppe von Leuten erreiche, breche ich einfach zusammen. Die Gläubigen schnappen nach Luft, als ich, ihr/e [Root.GetTitle], anfange, Auszüge aus der Schrift [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] zu zitieren. Ich verdrehe meine Augen nach hinten, während ich spreche, als würde ich mich an den Himmel selbst wenden. Als meine letzten Worte verklingen, beginnen die Leute zu wispern. Einen Moment lang bin ich davon überzeugt, dass mein Trick gelungen ist. Doch dann stößt mich der/die [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] an: Äh, mein/e [Root.GetLordLady]? Lasst mich Euch wieder auf die Füße helfen."
column6: Avanzo y tomo una atrevida decisión: cuando llego hasta un grupo de gente, me desplomo en el suelo. A los adoradores se les corta la respiración cuando yo, su [Root.GetTitle], empiezo a citar fragmentos de las sagradas escrituras. Pongo los ojos en blanco mientras hablo, como si estuviera viendo los cielos mismos. Cuando pronuncio las últimas palabras, empiezan a susurrar. Por un momento creo que mi ardid ha funcionado. Entonces el religioso exclama: Eh... ¿mi [Root.GetLordLady]? Te ayudaré a levantarte"."

column2: There are those among us who honor the darkest and most sinister of the Otherworlders. These Petitioners revel in the chaos, bloodshed, and hedonism demanded of them by the Unseelie Court. Unfortunately it seems the Unseelie are pleased by the havoc their mortal followers cause, as there are disturbing rumors surrounding the Petitioners, of dark magic and unnaturally long lives...
The High Priest of The Petitioners
Attempt to find out whether §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! is open to the power of the occult. If so, you may invite [Root.GetHerHim] to become a Petitioner.
Has not been approached by the Unseelie Petitioners before.
The person that this title is bestowed upon is considered to be the Champion of the Realm. There is surely no greater honor for mortal men to aspire to.
column3: La personne à qui ce titre est décerné est considérée comme le champion du royaume. Aucun mortel ne saurait espérer titre plus honorable.
column4: Die Person, die diesen Titel erhalten hat, wird als Champion des Reiches angesehen. Es gibt wahrlich keine größere Ehre für Sterbliche.
column6: La persona a la que se le otorga este título es considerada como el Campeón del Reino. No se puede aspirar a un honor mayor para los hombres mortales.

column2: The Master of Arms is responsible for maintaining the production and storage of weapons and armor in the realm. An important and prestigious post.

The "keeper of the flock" is responsible for the realm's herds of sacrificial animals. They manage the shepherds and priests who ensure the animals are raised according to the sacrificial requirements, as dictated by the gods.

The "judges of hellenes" are responsible for maintaining the integrity of athletic competitions. The hellanodikai collectively arrange the various games and events for grand competitions such as the Olympics, and more local tournaments. They are also responsible for judging the outcomes of the games, and are held to an impeccable standard of honesty and justice.
Convert all characters to a not Christian and not Muslim religion, based on culture. Does not affect religious heads, so the Caliphate remains. May bring older machines to their knees.
Turn the world pagan by culture. This is mostly for development.

Do you want to turn most of the world pagan? Be warned, nearly every single character will receive an event that converts their religion and that of their personal demesne. This may bring older computers to their knees. This is an unsupported feature primarily for development use!
This character is too afraid of persecution to join.
These bottles of otherwise acceptable wine have been infused with a, potentially deadly, poison.
This wine is weak, both in flavor and alcohol. It is good for cooking and desperate drunks.
These bottles contain average wine. It won't offend anyone, but it won't impress either.
This wine is of a good quality, something all but the most particular pallete would enjoy.
This batch of wine is of surpassing quality, very few ever experience the pleasure of drinking a wine like this.
These bottles are the pinnacle of wine-making. Skill alone could not produce such a draught, only divine intervention could provide the necessary circumstances.
